Package curam.util.xmlserver

The Curam XML Server is a Java application that processes XML documents generated by a Curam application server, applying XSL templates and rendering to PDF, RTF, HTML, or plain text.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DocumentGenerator
    This interface is to be implemented by all DocumentGenerators that are going to be registered with XMLServer for the purpose of printing documents.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    SimplePrintService
    This is a Sample print service utility implementation to print documents.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    XMLException
    Parent class for all XML exceptions.
    XMLJobException
    Exception thrown when the XML job fails.
    XMLServerPrintException
    Exception thrown when the Print job fails.

Package curam.util.xmlserver Description

The Curam XML Server is a Java application that processes XML documents generated by a Curam application server, applying XSL templates and rendering to PDF, RTF, HTML, or plain text. The application server and the XML Server do not have to be co-located; they may be hosted on different machines. There can also be any number of XML Servers, each given a specific task. The XML Server was primarily designed to support printing of XML documents, however, it can be configured in a myriad of ways to perform many different tasks. See the Curam XML Infrastructure Guide for more information.
Since:
Curam SDEJ3.0.0
